snippet: Prime Minister Tony Abbott of Australia pledged Monday to work with Indonesia to stop the flow of people traveling by boat to Australia to seek asylum.
abstract: Australian Prime Min Tony Abbott pledges to work with Indonesia to stop the flow of people traveling by boat to Australia to seek asylum, even as his new government pursues a tough policy of turning back vessels that has created diplomatic tensions between the two countries.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Tony Abbott of Australia pledged Monday to work with Indonesia to stop the flow of people traveling by boat to Australia to seek asylum.

headline.main: Indonesia: Australian Leader Aims to Halt Flow of Asylum Seekers
headline.print_headline: Indonesia: Australian Leader Aims To Halt Flow of Asylum Seekers
